summary: Just a simple retex to make it look like the ghostly weapons
descriptionHtml:
Well, not really a RETEX per se, I just changed attributes of the original mesh and instead of the common texture, I linked the \"_n\" texture, like the ghostly weapons also do.

I did that to use with this mod: http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/7898 - Ethereal Shields beta
The author used the glass shield model to make a shield without armor rating, so mages could use one and still keep the mage armor bonus.

Thing is, the Glass Shield, as nice as it looks, still looks bulky for a mage, so I remembered \"what about the ghostly weapons? I\'m sure there is a ghostly shield, since I didn\'t explore every corner of the game yet!\"
And there wasn\'t. There wasn\'t even an \"ancient nordic shield\". So, I made this and changed the directories in the esp, pointing to the right files. :p

Just a side-note: You can use it as a replacement, since it uses vanilla meshes and textures. Just put it in the folder of the shield you want to replace and rename correctly, like \"Data\\meshes\\armor\\shieldofysgramor\\shieldofysgramor.nif\" [mine is called ghostlyshieldofysgramor.nif]

Edit: The whole purpose of this mod got surpassed by two things. One, the fact that using a shield doesn\'t count as wearing armor, thus not affecting the mage armor perk. And two, the mod Staves of Skyrim [ http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/22691 ] is a MUCH BETTER solution to the whole mage and shield problem. Check it before you make any assumptions!
author: emieri00
